text: The Mesopotamian barbel or leopard barbel (Luciobarbus subquincunciatus) is a cyprinid in the genus Luciobarbus found in the Tigris–Euphrates river system. After 12 years of being lost, in January 2024, a local fisherman caught a specimen of the fish. == Related pages == * Mangar – another fish found in the Tigris–Euphrates Basin == References == Category:IUCN Red List critically endangered species Category:Freshwater fish Category:Ray-finned fish Category:Cypriniformes Category:Animals of Asia
title: Mesopotamian barbel
